page.title: 15LANGUAGE:DIALECT:MK WESTON
page.content: In the villages of Market Weston & Barningham there is still a pronounced Suffolk accent especially amongst the older members of the community who were born & have remained in the area.Even though the Norfolk border is so close the accents are quite different.Word usage is at times different from modern English with words from old English still in use - "housen" for houses; "musmidor":a May bug;"hodmedod":snail. The word "now" in use repeatedly:"I'm now going","she is now coming". The sound "h" often appearing before words "ain't" being "h'ain't" & seldom drop- ped as in the London accent. "Good o' bor" thought to derive from "Good neighbour" which is still its meaning. Sadly much of the usage of Suffolk words & dialect is disappearing with the influence of TV & radio, also the influx of people from out of the area.
